abstract: Knight Frank, the London-based global property agency, has released what it calls the first reliable analysis of residential real estate prices in China’s 10 top cities.
snippet: Knight Frank, the London-based global property agency, has released what it calls the first reliable analysis of residential real estate prices in China’s 10 top cities.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — No wonder the Chinese government is trying to extend its winter chill to the residential market. Average home prices in Shanghai leapt 68 percent last year, according to new research, while Beijing shot up 66 percent and Shenzhen, 51 percent.

headline.main: New Analysis of China's Real Estate Market Shows 'Dramatic' Growth
headline.print_headline: New Analysis of China's Real Estate Market Shows 'Dramatic' Growth
